intro: Palafoxia linearis var. linearis, commonly known as narrowleaf palafoxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, linear leaves and produces showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soils. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in native plant gardens and ecological studies.
